venue.address_1: Just south of the Highland Center
venue.name: Crawford Depot

item.description:
I have hiked this a couple times, always south to north, this time I would like to go North to South. I am hoping we get enough participants that we can spot a car at the Willey House Station Site. Trails we will be taking, Avalon, A-Z, Mt Tom Spur, Willey Range, and Ethan Pond.

I estimate this hike to be 8.5 miles and am allowing 8.5 hours depending on trail conditions and hikers abilities. I would like to finish in under 6 hours.

I will have my black lab Bond with me, if you do not like to hike with dogs this is not the trip for you. I will allow other dogs as long as they are well behaved, in shape, and have done similar winter hikes.

Carpool leaving from LL Bean Parking lot in Concord NH at 6AM

Meet at trail head at the Crawford Depot just south of the Highland Center at 7:45AM for car spotting

On the trail by 8:30 AM

This is an intermediate/advanced hike, you are responsible for yourself and are expected to have all necessary winter gear and clothing. I do not expect crampons to be necessary, but will require you have snowshoes and microspikes. A headlamp is also a requirement.

For your reference if you need it is a link to AMCâ€™s list for Essential Winter Gear for Northeastern Hikes, http://www.outdoors.org/publications/outdoors/2002/2002-winter-gear.cfm

If I do not think you are equipped or in shape for this hike I will not allow you to hike with us.

I will be bringing my butt sled, but be warned, there are some steep sections, some with ladders, any of which could be hazardous.

Everyone will be waitlisted so I can get a feel for how prepared you are for this hike. I will limit this hike to about 10 people. I will require a phone number for last minute communications if needed. I have a couple afternoon and evening events this week so be patient with my responses. Please RSVP early, before Friday at 10 PM.

I am working on finishing my winter 4Ks this year, if you are interested in joining me just ask, I will send you my tentative schedule of hikes.

Disclaimer

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code; http://hikesafe.com/index.php?page=hiker-responsibility-code ; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.name: Mt Tom, Field, and Willey
